Description: A large standard truncated convex bicone name-bead: roughly shaped, made from pale blue-green glazed composition. The boring is wide and irregular. It is inscribed with a cartouche containing the prenomen of Amenemhat II; the hieroglyphs are filled with a brownish varnish-like substance.
Curator's comments: Beads with the name of Amenemhat II: cf. W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Scarabs and Cylinders with Names Illustrated by the Egyptian Collection in University College, London’ (London, 1917), pl.XIII, 7 = University College. London 11275A (glazed steatite); ibid, pl.XIII. 8 = University College. London 11276 (brown limestone). Bibliography: E. A. Wallis Budge 'A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room' (London, 1922), 144, no. 52.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (457)
